title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

what: Pull Request and Code Review Standards
title: Pull Request and Code Review Standards
text: Please check existing issue closed given PR. Unless ’s trivial change (spelling mistake, code formatting, etc.), likely case. Give branch PR informative name PR close existing issue, name branch format: \<issue_number\>-short-description (e.g. `186_implement_data_extract`). PR doesn’t close existing issue, name branch format: \short-description (e.g. `improve-reshape-docs`) title PR provide brief description changes. PR linked issue(s) targets, either using keywords (like fixes, closes, etc.) PR description searching issue dropdown menu Development section right-side sidebar GitHub website. PR doesn’t close issues, please either link comment discussion motivated provide detailed description explain motivation PR. PR work progress, please mark draft PR using GitHub checkbox add [WIP] PR title. Reviewers delay code review draft PRs marked ready review (removing [WIP] title unchecking “Draft” box), unless otherwise requested contributors. PR marked “Ready Review”, contributors remember remove WIP PR title. marking PR “Ready Review”, contributors also make sure following tidyverse style guide (enforced via styler package) make sure automatic GitHub tests finish successfully. possible tests finish successfully reason (e.g., PR relies changes repositories), contributor create new issue(s) required code changes, link PR, shortly explain change PR possible. general, fix one issue PR, open new PRs fix issues. number issues related underlying functionality, okay address multiple issues single PR. ’s PR adds significant new functionality, might multiple tasks completed. cases, try prepare checklist PR description keep updated reviewers contributors always --date view status PR. PR makes user-visible change include bump package version number (x.y.z.v -> x.y.z.v + 1) entry NEWS.md (name contributor contributor author issue number available). Reviewers due diligence understand underlying issue, instead asking contributors reiterate details already outlined GitHub Issues/Discussions. reviewers missed issue motivated PR like discuss see PR, discussion take place original issue PR minimize cognitive overhead tracking discussion two different places minimize possibility talking past . responsibility resolving code review comments falls squarely reviewers. contributors shouldn’t resolve review comments, even 100% confident latest commits address review comments. Reviewers forget review test code make sure follows organization’s coding standards. Code review comments strictly follow ethical decorum stipulated Code Conduct. Reviewers refrain making remarks can potentially construed hurtful dismissive contributors (e.g. “LMAO, hell ?!”). comments constructive, irrespective whether terse detailed. Even contributors possess right merge PRs protected branches without code review, exercise power responsibly circumvent “number required reviews” condition stipulated protected branch.

title: Citing 'easystats'
text: reference easystats? Cite specific packages parsimonious approach cite particular package helped , e.g., “using bayestestR (Makowski, Ben-Shachar, & Lüdecke, 2019)”. Cite whole ecosystem ❤️ Want credit whole easystats ecosystem packages? can done sentence like following: Data processing carried R (R Core Team, 2019) easystats ecosystem (Lüdecke, Waggoner, & Makowski, 2019; Lüdecke, Ben-Shachar, Patil, Waggoner, & Makowski, 2021; Makowski, Ben-Shachar, & Lüdecke, 2019; Makowski, Ben-Shachar, Patil, & Lüdecke, 2020; Lüdecke, Ben-Shachar, Patil, & Makowski, 2020; Lüdecke et al., 2021; Ben-Shachar, Lüdecke, & Makowski, 2020) Lüdecke, D., Waggoner, P. D., & Makowski, D. (2019). insight: Unified Interface Access Information Model Objects R. Journal Open Source Software, 4, 1412. https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.01412 Makowski, D., Ben-Shachar, M.S., & Lüdecke, D. (2019). bayestestR: Describing Effects Uncertainty, Existence Significance within Bayesian Framework. Journal Open Source Software, 4(40), 1541. https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.01541 Makowski, D., Ben-Shachar, M.S., Patil, ., & Lüdecke, D. (2019). Methods Algorithms Correlation Analysis R. Journal Open Source Software, 5(51), 2306. https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.02306 Lüdecke, D., Ben-Shachar, M.S., Patil, ., & Makowski, D. (2020). parameters: Extracting, Computing Exploring Parameters Statistical Models using R. Journal Open Source Software, 5(53), 2445. https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.02445 Ben-Shachar, M.S., Lüdecke, D., Makowski, D. (2020). effectsize: Estimation Effect Size Indices Standardized Parameters. Journal Open Source Software, 5(56), 2815. https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.02815 Lüdecke, D., Ben-Shachar, M.S., Patil, ., Waggoner, P. D., & Makowski, D. (2021). performance: R Package Assessment, Comparison Testing Statistical Models. Journal Open Source Software, 6(60), 3139. https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.03139 Lüdecke, D., Patil, ., Ben-Schachar, M.S., Wiernik, B.M., Waggoner, P., & Makowski, D. (2021). see: R Package Visualizing Statistical Models. Journal Open Source Software, 6(64), 3393, https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.03393

text: easystats different tidyverse? ’ve probably already heard tidyverse, another popular collection packages (ggplot, dplyr, tidyr, …) also makes using R easier. , pick tidyverse easystats? Pick ! Indeed, two ecosystems designed different goals mind. tidyverse packages primarily made create new R experience, data manipulation exploration intuitive consistent. hand, easystats focuses final stretch analysis: understanding interpreting results reporting manuscript report, following best practices. can definitely use easystats functions tidyverse workflow! easystats + tidyverse = ❤️ Can easystats useful advanced users /developers? Yes, definitely! easystats built terms modules general enough used inside packages. instance, insight package made easily implement support post-processing pretty much regression model packages sun. use easystats packages, also used non-easystats packages, ggstatsplot, modelsummary, ggeffects, . ?
